Package spielwitz.biDiServer

Class Server

java.lang.Object
spielwitz.biDiServer.Server
public abstract class Server
extends java.lang.Object
The server that can receive requests from the clients and push notifications to the clients.
Author:
spielwitz

    static java.lang.String FOLDER_NAME_ROOT

  • Field Details

    • FOLDER_NAME_ROOT

      public static final java.lang.String FOLDER_NAME_ROOT
      The name of the root folder where the server stores all data. The name is "ServerData".
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • Server

      protected Server​(ServerConfiguration config, java.lang.String homeDir) throws ServerException
      Instantiate a server object instance.
      Parameters:
      config - The server configuration
      homeDir - Home file directory where all server data is stored
      Throws:
      ServerException - Server exception

  • Method Details

    • onCustomRequestMessageReceived

      protected abstract Tuple<ResponseInfo,​java.lang.Object> onCustomRequestMessageReceived​(java.lang.String userId, java.lang.Object payloadRequest)
      A request message of type CUSTOM was received at the server. Process your own logic here.
      Parameters:
      userId - User ID
      payloadRequest - Request payload
      Returns:
      The response message info and the response message payload

    • onConfigurationUpdated

    • setDataSetInfoPayloadObject

      protected abstract java.lang.Object setDataSetInfoPayloadObject​(java.lang.String dataId, java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> userIds, java.lang.Object dataSetPayloadObject, java.lang.Object currentDataSetInfoPayloadObject)
      Set the payload object of a data set info object.
      Parameters:
      dataId - Data set ID
      userIds - Users related to the data set
      dataSetPayloadObject - Data set payload object
      currentDataSetInfoPayloadObject - Current data set info payload object
      Returns:
      New data info payload object

    • migrateDataSet

      protected abstract com.google.gson.JsonElement migrateDataSet​(java.lang.String className, com.google.gson.JsonElement jsonElementBeforeMigration)
      Migrate a data set when the server is started.
      Parameters:
      className - Name of the class of the data set payload
      jsonElementBeforeMigration - JSON representation of the data set payload before migration
      Returns:
      Null, is no migration is required. Or else, the new JSON representation of the data set payload after migration

    • checkServerClientBuild

      protected abstract ServerClientBuildCheckResult checkServerClientBuild​(java.lang.String clientBuild)
      Check the server and the client build.
      Parameters:
      clientBuild - The client build
      Returns:
      True, if server and client are compatible. Also the minimum compatible build of the server is returned.
